text: Hi everyone, I'm configuring to work locally with a Mac. But I am faced with a problem, every hs command (ex. hs init) doesn't work, it returns me command not found. Has this happened to anyone yet? Many thanks in advance
have you installed the tools globally using npm -g or or locally?
Depending on how you installed Node, you might need to add `/usr/local/bin` to your path.
I am using Node through Powershell.
<@U0183NGLSUD> I haven't been able to get this working yet. It might be because I'm running webpack through gulp
<@U26B530N6> - I just tried running through my standard command prompt (`cmd`) and it did work! Good thought!
not sure if you've received any other feedback yet
Hey <@UDHT6N5SM>, it is untested using webpack through gulp, but if you head to Github and create an issue then we'll see what can be done.
ok, will do. I wasn't sure I should include it as an issue because of the unique setup
maybe I'll try to strip it down with an example...
I spoke to soon. I did it once, and now any way I run the `hs create module` command from even the command prompt will cause the same error as above. Totally baffled!
Hmm strange. Are you able to create a module inside of your user directory? I’m wondering if it’s a permissions issue
I can create the ModuleName.module folder and add all of the files manually
